      • PathFinder

    • Method Detail

      • initGrid

        public void initGrid​(Node startNode,
                     Node endNode)
        Grid is initialized using the already drawn nodes and edges. This method will use a downScale, which is decrementing after each unsuccessful search for a valid path, to increase precision and number of possible edges.

      • clearCenterOfNode

        private void clearCenterOfNode​(Node node)
        Clears the center of a node. This is used to make sure the center of the start node and end node is vacant to be visited by the BFS algorithm
        Parameters:
        node - start node and end node

      • initNodes

        private void initNodes​(java.util.List<Node> nodes)
        Takes every node in the sproutModel and marks their location in the grid
        Parameters:
        nodes - every node in the game

      • initFailedNodes

        private void initFailedNodes()
        When we create a new line we want to ensure there is room for a point on it that does not visually collide with other game objects. This takes the points that has been put on the new line but failed and marks them in the grid. This forces the BFS to traverse around these in order to find a new path with room for a node.

      • findNodeCoverageOfFailedNode

        private void findNodeCoverageOfFailedNode​(double x,
                                          double y,
                                          Node failedNode)
        Recursively finds the area in the grid the point covers and marks it *true* in the grid
        Parameters:
        x - center x of point
        y - center y of point
        failedNode - the node to find coverage of

      • findNodeCoverage

        private void findNodeCoverage​(double x,
                              double y,
                              Node node)
        Recursively finds the area in the grid the point covers and marks it *true* in the grid
        Parameters:
        x - center x of point
        y - center y of point
        node - the node to find coverage of

      • removeStartAndEndNodeCoverage

        private void removeStartAndEndNodeCoverage​(double x,
                                           double y,
                                           Node node)
        Recursively finds the area in the grid the start and end point covers and marks it *false* in the grid
        Parameters:
        x - center x of point
        y - center y of point
        node - the node to find coverage of

        private boolean isPointInsideFailedNode​(Point p)

        private void initEdges​(java.util.List<javafx.scene.shape.Shape> edges)
        Takes every element of the lines in the game and marks them as *true* in the grid
        Parameters:

      • backtrace

        private java.util.ArrayList<Point> backtrace​(Point[][] parent,
                                             Node startNode,
                                             Node endNode)
        Takes parent list from BFS to backtrack path from start point to end point
        Parameters:
        parent - list containing corresponding parent to each point
        startNode - start node
        endNode - goal node
        Returns:
        reversed list of points in the path from the start node to the end node

      • BFS

        public java.util.ArrayList<Point> BFS​(Node startNode,
                                      Node endNode)
                               throws NoValidEdgeException
        Breadth first search used for traversing the grid
        Parameters:
        startNode - start node
        endNode - goal node
        Returns:
        reversed list of points in path from start node to end point or null if no such path exist
        Throws:
        NoValidEdgeException

      • findPath

        public javafx.scene.shape.Path findPath​(Node startNode,
                                        Node endNode)
                                 throws NoValidEdgeException
        Builds the Path object from the path list from BFS. The path will start at the non-scaled start node, and end at the non-scaled end node, to make sure the path will connect to the points. Also ensures that the path returned has room for a new node that does not collide visually with other game objects
        Parameters:
        startNode - start node
        endNode - goal node
        Returns:
        Path from start node to end node
        Throws:
        NoValidEdgeException

      • searchForLargerLegalPath

        private java.util.ArrayList<Point> searchForLargerLegalPath​(Node startNode,
                                                            Node endNode,
                                                            Node failedNode)
        Searches for a larger path around the points on a new line that overlapped other game objects
        Parameters:
        startNode - start node
        endNode - goal node
        failedNode - the node to find a path around
        Returns:
        a new path to test for legal point or null if no such path was found

      • generatePathFromPoints

        private javafx.scene.shape.Path generatePathFromPoints​(Node startNode,
                                                       Node endNode,
                                                       java.util.ArrayList<Point> pathListReversed)
        Generates the Path object by going through the points found by BFS and scaling them back to real coordinates and putting them together
        Parameters:
        startNode - start node
        endNode - goal node
        pathListReversed - list of coordinates found in BFS
        Returns:
        the new path between the start and end point

      • getLoopPath

        public javafx.scene.shape.Path getLoopPath​(Node startNode)
                                    throws NoValidEdgeException
        It will use a helper point for the BFS method and then use BFS back to the start point
        Parameters:
        startNode - Node to make self loop for
        Returns:
        Looping path from the start node
        Throws:
        NoValidEdgeException

                                                  int i,
                                                  int j,
                                                  Operator[] ops)
        Places a test node i,j away from the start node
        Parameters:
        startNode - start node for self loop
        i - y-coordinate offset
        j - x-coordinate offset
        ops - operator pair
        Returns:
        2 paths one from start node to test node, and one from
